bitfield.description: Setting this bit will cause the h/w to fetch the bit plane data from the address specified at VEC_VC1_FE_BITPLANES_BASE_ADDR0 [0x418].
Setting this bit to '1' instructs the back-end EntDec parser to start parsing the Rendec stream.
This is a status bit to indicate if parsing of the Bit Plane data has completed or not.
Setting this bit to '1' instructs the VC-1 Bit Plane decoder to start parsing the stream.
Setting this bit to '1' instructs the front-end EntDec parser to start parsing the bit stream.
Enable the multicore support
Insert a fence operation into the memory interface for the last write of the macroblock row before updating the macroblock row count
Instead of providing the vdeb macroblock_row_count from the current core, bypass the vdeb macroblock_row_count from the upper core to the lower core in the chain
Sync core ordinal allows the dependent upstream core [and associated sync value] to be selected.
Picture number value to be compared to the sync value passed from the upstream decode core.
Picture number value of the current decode to be passed to the downstream decode core.
Macroblock row offset to be subtracted from the external macroblock row count.

register.description: Controls the target module that is accessed by the MTX co-pro port.

bitfield.description: Controls the target module that is accessed by the MTX co-pro port.
Indicates that the SW has already extracted the macroblock_inc value and placed it in cr_macroblock_address_inc.
When this bit is set to '1', the completion of VC-1 Bit Plane decoding is notified via VEC_END_OF_SLICE bit of interrupt status register of MSVDX.
DMAC-CH1 burst length control set up by VLRIF when fetching the bitplane data or slice group map data from memory.
Provides an extension to the ENTDEC_FE_MODE field to allow additional codecs.
Defines profile for the front-end of Entdec [definition based on ENTDEC_FE_MODE]
Define which standard the stream [being processed by the front-end] belongs to
Provies an extension to the ENTDEC_BE_MODE field
Defines profile for the back-end of Entdec [definition based on ENTDEC_BE_MODE]
Define which standard the stream [being processed by the back-end] belongs to
Used to select the instance of the Shift Register that can be accessed by the Entropy Decoder
Used to select the instance of the Shift Register that can be accessed via the MTX Co-processor Port
Reset all the metric values in all instances of the Shift Register
Used to select the instance of the Shift Register that can be accessed via the register interface
Codec mode which the shift register works in [affects emulation prevention detection and other operations fro JPEG].
If SR_RBDU_EXTRACT is set, then this field affects how byte count works
If SR_READ_MODE = 0 and byte count is set, then fifo will be filled in zeroes when byte count becomes zero
Specifies which requestor is the master of this Shift Register channel
Controls the assertion of DREQ from ShiftReg to DMAC
Controls whether the
Controls whether ShiftReg FIFO is used as a
When set, indicates that the RBDU should be based on JPEG stuffed bytes rather than the emualtion bytes of other standards
Controls 'raw bit stream data unit' extraction
Controls whether Start Code Prefixes are detected or whether byte_count is used to control the amount of data read through the ShiftReg
Allows pre-emption of any pending MTX ShiftReg Co-processor read
Shift Register software reset

register.description: Used to control the amount of bit stream data that can be read through the Shift RegisterNOTE: Writing to this register clears the End-of-Data flag and allows more bit stream data to be read through the Shift Register

bitfield.description: Count of bytes that should be processed before returning control to MTX.
Input for the compressed bit stream
In byte count mode, SR_BYTE_COUNT*8 + SR_BIT_OFFSET indicates the number of bits left [this is mainly for firmware to know the bit offset at the end of a slice header].
If SR_RBDU_EXTRACT is set, this field indicates the number of emulation prevention bytes which have been removed [where the count is aligned to the actual bits consumed from the shift register]
Codec mode which the shift register works in [affects emulation prevention detection and other operations fro JPEG].

Controls whether ShiftReg FIFO is used as a

Controls whether Start Code Prefixes are detected or whether byte_count is used to control the amount of data read through the ShiftReg
Allows pre-emption of any pending MTX ShiftReg Co-processor read
Shift Register software reset

register.description: Provides direct access to the most significant 32-bits of the Shift Register co-processor response port

bitfield.description: Indicates the Shift Register response contains valid data.
Indicates whether the Shift Register is being reset
Indicates whether the next bit in the Shift Register is byte aligned
Use to signal more raw bit stream data

register.description: Provides direct access to the least significant 32-bits of the Shift Register co-processor response port

bitfield.description: Requested bits or signed/unsigned Exp-Goulomb value

register.description: Provides direct access to the most significant 32-bits of the Shift Register co-processor command port

bitfield.description: Read Peek Extended.
Discard or flush bits from the bit stream before read/peek/skip - 0 to 31
The number of bits to read/peek - 0 to
The access mode:
Writing 1 to this bit initialises the Rendec decoder contexts to the default value.
Writing 1 to this bit initialises the Rendec encoder contexts to the default value.
When a lock-up is detected at the front-end, s/w must write 1 to this bit before resetting the front-end modules.
Writing '1' to this bit instructs the back-end of entdec to search for the MTX_to_MTX header.
Writing '1' to this bit instructs the Rendec/decoder to skip to the next slice.
Writing '1' to this bit flushes the Rendec/encoder remaining bit stream with [if necessary] some extra bits so that the encoded bit stream is aligned to the programmed memory burst size.
Writing 1 to this bit initialises the Rendec encoder/decoder contexts to the default value.
Error flag control for rendec.
Rendec stream select for back-end.
Rendec is flushed upon the front-end parser and vec_fe_end_of_slice interrupt is set when the rendec flush is completed
Rendec stream select for front-end.
Rendec Decoder Disable mode.
Rendec Decoder operates in slice mode
The s/w must set this bit when the front-end parser has completed the decoding of the stream.
Used to enable/disable the use of external memory:
Burst size of the Rendec write in memory-words [1 word = 16 bytes]
Burst size of the Rendec read in memory-words [1 word = 16 bytes]
The Rendec decode start control, specified in
The size of the Rendec buffer 1 in external memory in units of 4kB.
The size of the Rendec buffer 0 in external memory in 4kB.
Base address 0 of the Rendec external memory buffer, the buffer must be aligned to a 4kB boundary
Base address 1 of the Rendec external memory buffer, the buffer must be aligned to a 4kB boundary
Write address pointer 0.
Write address pointer 1.
External buffer read address
External buffer read address
The size of the Rendec stream data 0 currently stored in the external memory buffer [in bytes]
The size of the Rendec stream data 1 currently stored in the external memory buffer [in bytes]
The value to be written to Rendec for MTX/Host messages
The value provided from Rendec to extract MTX/Host messages
This is a real-time monitor of the currently decoded Rendec data.
This bit is set when the currently decoded Rendec data contains an error
Indicates whether the currently decoded Rendec data is the header after EndOfSlice or not.
Empty_flag status of the Rendec decoder FIFO1
Empty_flag status of the Rendec decoder FIFO0
Full_flag status of the Rendec encoder FIFO1
Full_flag status of the Rendec encoder FIFO0
Rendec Differential Slice Counter for the primary rendec stream.

register.description: Initialises the context of the Bool-Coder internal state.

bitfield.description: The initial range for the Bool-Coder.
The initial value of the Bool-Coder.

register.description: Controls the master access to the Bool-Coder.

bitfield.description: Selects the master controller for the Bool-Coder.
Provides the latest macroblock vertical address that has been successfully decoded by Entdec
Provides the latest macroblock horizontal address that has been successfully decoded by Entdec
Indicates the real-time status of Entdec front-end parser.

register.description: A write to this register triggers a Bool decode operation. It also causes the Bool-Coder Result Register to be cleared to 0.

bitfield.description: Indicates the number of Bools - 1 that should be decoded.
The probability to be used for all Bools to be decoded.

register.description: Register contains the result of a bool-decode operation. It is cleared to 0, when a write to the Bool-Coder Command Register occurs, and updated with the result when it has been calculated.

bitfield.description: Indicates that the BOOL_RESULT field contains the result from the previously executed command.
The result from the previously executed command, with Bools left-shifted into the result field in the order they are decoded.

Direct mode data register 0.
